alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN LATAH...SOUTHERN BENEWAH...NORTHEASTERN ADAMS...NORTHEASTERN WHITMAN...SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHERN SPOKANE COUNTIES... At 559 PM PST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Ritzville to 15 miles northwest of Potlatch. Movement was east at 25 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Ritzville, Tekoa, Garfield, Rosalia, St. John, Sprague, Oakesdale, Malden, Latah, Farmington, Tensed, Lamont, Emida, Amber, Tokio, Revere, Belmont, Sanders, Thornton, and Santa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 218 and 253. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 367 and 390. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 50 and 72. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes. &&
